name: Sunnybank Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: ..a lovely place to stay where you realise why this place has a truly international reputation. Charming hosts, lovely beds, perfect quiet location, delightful breakfast. I had a small room (reflected in the price) which was ideal for me alone. Just perfect.
reviews.title: Rightly world famous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited recently with my wife on a short cycling tour of the North. We like the freedom of not pre-booking at fixed destinations, and so were recommended Sunnybank by the local Tourist Information Office when we pitched up in Holmfirth after a tiring day cycling.
reviews.title: Terrific and accommodating B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Fantastic quality, lovely outlook, super rooms and a great breakfast. Not to mention considerate owners who took the trouble to find somewhere we could put our bikes safely for the night. What more can I say? I will make a bee line for Sunnybank next time I'm near.
reviews.title: A beautiful house run by friendly caring people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually choose a hotel rather than a B & B but my stay here has made me reconsider. The rooms are large beautifully furnished and comfortable. The service was perfect, neither too intrusive nor standoffish. There was a good choice for breakfast which had obviously been cooked by someone who cared. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Best bed and breakfast I've ever stayed in by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunnybank is a lovely B&B. It's extremely well run and with great care and attention to detail. Our room (Garden View) though not large, was of high quality - very comfortable and far out-classed many (more expensive) hotel rooms I've stayed in. The cosy guest lounge with roaring fire and the outstanding breakfast room (and food) are the icing on the cake. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: As Expected Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We just had a two night stay at Sunnybank. The room was absolute luxury, the welcome from the management and the food of the same excellent quality.
reviews.title: Sunnybank and it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We have stayed in some right rough places in the past but this one does not fit into that category.
reviews.title: Good B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is situated right next door to summer wines Bill owens resting place at the local church in Holmfirth, just down the road is sids cafe and Nora Batty's. If you want to do summer wine or just relax in the Holme valley then Sunnybank is the place to stay. A fantastic hotel with friendly staff and clean throughout. The bath (never mind the shower) in our room was luxurious. Lovely. First rate hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service, quaint hotel, friendly and great food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night to attend a gig in Holmfirth. Couple who run the place are very friendly. Couldn't fault the room. Very clean all round and bed very comfortable. Only minor draw back is the breakfast room with one big table sitting 6 people. As a solo traveller I found this a bit uncomfortable. The B&B is about a 15 min walk into the village but it is a bit of a steep walk coming back.
reviews.title: what a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again
reviews.title: opulent luxury in bygone surroundings - a real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a delightful stay at Sunnybank. We were attending a 21st birthday party just outside Holmfirth and at the last minute decided to stay over rather than drive back to Cheshire.
reviews.title: Utterly Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: . A couple of years ago we stayed at Bagden Hall when the same family invited us to their son's 21st and despite Bagden Hall being a hotel and Sunnybank a guest house I can honestly say that Sunnybank is far superior in every way to Bagden Hall.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Great Views, Great Location and we recommend Sunnybank.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I called first to see what availability they had and Jason was very helpful describing each room and the views, bathrooms etc.
reviews.title: First class guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Valley Suite and it really is gorgeous, lovely crisp bedlinen, huge soft and fluffy bathsheets, candles around the bath and all the little extras you get in five star hotels.
reviews.title: Relaxing heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jason and Rachel are charming hosts, Jason cooked a superb breakfast. I don't normally eat sausages but the ones they serve are delicious. All the produce is sourced locally and meals are presented with though and flair. The fresh flowers on the breakfast table were welcoming on a very wet miserable day.
reviews.title: excellent all round accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: After a warm welcome, we found the new Valley side rooms to be new and well appointed and ever so quiet. The breakfast was most excellent in the lovely dining room and the grounds offer plenty of garden to just kick back and relax. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Quiet location with a touch of class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I chose this B&B on its excellent reviews, 5 stars and breakfast award imagine our surprise on arrival to find we were the first guests that the NEW managers had taken solo after a handover period of 2 weeks from the owners.
reviews.title: Under New Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The young host and hostess were pleasant and friendly and tried very hard. Their inexperience showed and things were missed, such as replenishing items used overnight, tea bags, biscuits etc and there were only 3 tissues in the box, when pointed out however these items were replaced with an apology. The toiletry dispensers in the bathroom were almost empty throughout the stay and the room was very cold on arrival but a heater was brought immediately. The décor, the beds, and towels etc were all fine and we are sure in time the new hosts will have mastered the art of excellence in this trade, however losing the odour of a smoker would be advantageous. At this time we feel that there is a need for a little more finesse and more attention is given to the small details that lift an average B&B to the 5 star.
reviews.title: Keep right on......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wish Rachel, Jason and the lovely Lily good luck for the future.
reviews.title: Excellent all round accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The drive up Upperthong Lane is not for the faint-hearted, but when you reach Sunnybank you find real treasure. Our room was spacious, clean & comfortable. Breakfast was delicious, and beautifully presented. We couldn't have been better looked after. Lovely garden too.
reviews.title: Agree wholeheartedly with the other top ratings

description: A delightful and elegant country Guesthouse, rated 5-star with a Gold award and recently short listed in the prestigious "Good Hotel Guide". Sunnybank is set in 'Last of the Summer Wine's' Holmfirth and offers a classic Yorkshire welcome in a relaxed manner, with outstanding accommodation, glorious views and serving top quality local produce.
